Author: Strob#3417
Content: What that bitcon core #2 dev says applies to the whole bitcoin network. But in the case of the small notary node network it may differ.

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Peers on the NN are not a scare ressource as every op can be a peer.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
That's not what he's saying.
If 8 people set 100 and connect to mostly the same peers that have 8 max, then those peers use up their open slots and can no longer propagate throughout the network

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: the more people you connect to that don't have extra opening is the more you close the loop

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Ok. So if4 NN op set 300 they will eat up other connections and srew up the others then?

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: yes, because 1/2 of all opens of the 300 will be taken by just them

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: (assuming 8 opens of ez math)

Author: Strob#3417
Content: In our case we have 16 outgoing by defaults.

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Anyway it would be good to know what everyone have done so far and see the effect on notarization. There's nothing like experimenting to really learn.

Author: Strob#3417
Content:
The same Pieter Wuille also says this on a related question: 
```css
Connecting to more nodes will not make you learn about transactions faster, after some point.

Your node will just be busy processing messages - including many uninteresting ones - to maintain connections with all peers, making it slower at processing new things.

Connect to a few fast peers with -addnode, or even run multiple nodes yourself, and interconnect them to each other. That will be faster than connecting directly to everyone.
```

Author: Strob#3417
Content: So I think I will just leave my maxconnection setting as they are...

Author: Strob#3417
Content: So it doesn't speed us up but it may slow down the others!

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Which is surely not the goal of a good NN operator. üòâ

Author: Strob#3417
Content:
Also:
```
what if i copy all nodes from blockchain.info/connected-nodes and do -addnode on my node, to force connect to all nodes ? ‚Äì AMB Jul 22 '17 at 5:25
You can't -addnode more than 8 peers. ‚Äì Pieter Wuille Jul 22 '17 at 5:57
```
So that's why there are only 8 of us at the beginning of the testnet.json ?

Author: Alright#0419
